homes_hear_details: South Carolina has not yet launched its HOMES or HEAR rebate programs under the Inflation Reduction Act. The South Carolina Office of Regulatory Staff - Energy Office is the designated state entity coordinating with the U.S. Department of Energy on program design.
state_energy_office: South Carolina Office of Regulatory Staff - Energy Office

income_thresholds.low_income_80_ami: For South Carolina, 80% of Area Median Income varies by county. In Richland County (Columbia), 80% AMI for a family of four is approximately $59,500. In Charleston County, it is approximately $64,750.
income_thresholds.moderate_income_150_ami: For South Carolina, 150% of Area Median Income varies by county. In Richland County (Columbia), 150% AMI for a family of four is approximately $111,600. In Charleston County, it is approximately $121,400.

net_metering: South Carolina has net metering for systems up to 20 kW for residential customers under the Energy Freedom Act (2019). Customers of investor-owned utilities receive credit at the retail rate for excess generation under the current net metering tariff, though the state is transitioning to a successor rate structure.

state_tax_credits.name: South Carolina Solar Energy and Small Hydroelectric Tax Credit
state_tax_credits.amount: 25% of the cost of a solar energy system, up to $3,500 per year (or 50% of tax liability), with unused credit carried forward for up to 10 years
state_tax_credits.eligible_items: Solar photovoltaic systems, solar thermal systems, and small hydroelectric systems installed on residential property
state_tax_credits.details: South Carolina offers one of the more generous state solar tax credits. The credit can be spread over multiple years if it exceeds the taxpayer's annual liability.

state_rebate_programs.name: Weatherization Assistance Program
state_rebate_programs.administrator: South Carolina Office of Economic Opportunity
state_rebate_programs.amount: Average expenditure of approximately $7,000 per home
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Insulation, air sealing, heating/cooling system repair or replacement, windows, doors
state_rebate_programs.details: Federally funded program for income-qualifying households at or below 200% of federal poverty level. Administered through community action agencies across South Carolina.

programs.name: Duke Energy Smart $aver Rebates
programs.amount: Up to $600 for heat pumps, $200 for smart thermostats, $300 for insulation
programs.eligible_items: High-efficiency heat pumps, central air conditioners, smart thermostats, insulation, duct sealing

programs.name: Duke Energy Home Energy Assessment
programs.eligible_items: Home energy evaluation identifying savings opportunities

programs.name: Dominion Energy Conservation Programs
programs.amount: Up to $500 for heat pumps, $200 for insulation, $100 for smart thermostats
programs.eligible_items: High-efficiency HVAC systems, heat pumps, insulation, smart thermostats

top_utilities.name: Santee Cooper (South Carolina Public Service Authority)

programs.name: Residential Rebate Programs
programs.amount: Up to $500 for heat pumps, $200 for insulation
programs.eligible_items: High-efficiency heat pumps, water heaters, insulation, duct sealing
